00059 //
00060 // EventManager::addListener             - Chapter 11, page 359
00061 //
00062 // Register a listener for a specific event type, implicitly the
00063 // event type will be added to the known event types if not
00064 // already known.
00065 //
00066 // The function will return false on failure for any reason. The
00067 // only really anticipated failure reason is if the input event
00068 // type is bad ( e.g.: known-ident number with different
00069 // signature text, or signature text is empty )
00070         
00071 bool EventManager::addListener (
00072         EventListenerPtr const & inListener,
00073         EventType const & inType )
00074 {
00075         if ( ! validateType( inType ) )
00076                 return false;
00077 
00078         // check / update type list
00079         
00080         EventTypeSet::iterator evIt = m_typeList.find( inType );
00081 
00082         if ( evIt == m_typeList.end() )
00083         {
00084                 // was not in the list, add it ...
00085                 
00086                 EventTypeSetIRes ires = m_typeList.insert( inType );
00087 
00088                 // insert failed for some reason
00089                 if ( ires.second == false )
00090                         return false;
00091 
00092                 // somehow we inserted and left the list empty!?!?!
00093                 if ( ires.first == m_typeList.end() )
00094                         return false;
00095 
00096                 evIt = ires.first; // store for later use
00097         }
00098 
00099         // find listener map entry, create one if no table already
00100         // exists for this entry ...
00101 
00102         EventListenerMap::iterator elmIt =
00103                 m_registry.find( inType.getIdent() );
00104 
00105         if ( elmIt == m_registry.end() )
00106         {
00107                 EventListenerMapIRes elmIRes = m_registry.insert(
00108                         EventListenerMapEnt( inType.getIdent(),
00109                                                                   EventListenerTable() ) );
00110 
00111                 // whoops, could not insert into map!?!?
00112                 if ( elmIRes.second == false )
00113                         return false;
00114 
00115                 // should not be possible, how did we insert and create
00116                 // an empty table!?!?!
00117                 if ( elmIRes.first == m_registry.end() )
00118                         return false;
00119 
00120                 // store it so we can update the mapped list next ...
00121                 elmIt = elmIRes.first;
00122         }
00123 
00124         // update the mapped list of listeners, walk the existing
00125         // list (if any entries) to prevent duplicate addition of
00126         // listeners. This is a bit more costly at registration time
00127         // but will prevent the hard-to-notice duplicate event
00128         // propogation sequences that would happen if double-entries
00129         // were allowed.
00130 
00131         // note: use reference to make following code more simple
00132         EventListenerTable & evlTable = (*elmIt).second;
00133         
00134         for ( EventListenerTable::iterator it = evlTable.begin(),
00135                           itEnd = evlTable.end(); it != itEnd ; it++ )
00136         {
00137                 bool bListenerMatch = ( *it == inListener );
00138 
00139                 if ( bListenerMatch )
00140                         return false;
00141         }
00142 
00143         // okay, event type validated, event listener validated,
00144         // event listener not already in map, add it
00145 
00146         evlTable.push_back( inListener );
00147 
00148         return true;
00149 }
00150 
00151 //
00152 // EventManager::delListener            - Chapter 11, page 361
00153 //
00154 // Remove a listener/type pairing from the internal tables
00155 //
00156 // Returns false if the pairing was not found.
00157 //
00158 bool EventManager::delListener (
00159         EventListenerPtr const & inListener, EventType const & inType )
00160 {
00161         if ( ! validateType( inType ) )
00162                 return false;
00163 
00164         bool rc = false;
00165 
00166         // brute force method, iterate through all existing mapping
00167         // entries looking for the matching listener and remove it.
00168 
00169         for ( EventListenerMap::iterator it = m_registry.begin(),
00170                           itEnd = m_registry.end(); it != itEnd; it++ )
00171         {
00172                 unsigned int const    kEventId = it->first;
00173                 EventListenerTable & table    = it->second;
00174 
00175                 for ( EventListenerTable::iterator it2 = table.begin(),
00176                                   it2End = table.end(); it2 != it2End; it2++ )
00177                 {
00178                         if ( *it2 == inListener )
00179                         {
00180                                 // found match, remove from table,
00181                                 table.erase( it2 );
00182 
00183                                 // update return code
00184                                 rc = true;
00185 
00186                                 // and early-quit the inner loop as addListener()
00187                                 // code ensures that each listener can only
00188                                 // appear in one event's processing list once.
00189                                 break;
00190                         }
00191                 }
00192         }
00193         
00194         return rc;
00195 }
00196 
00197 //
00198 // EventManager::trigger                - Chapter 11, page 362
00199 //
00200 // Fire off event - synchronous - do it NOW kind of thing -
00201 // analogous to Win32 SendMessage() API.
00202 //
00203 // returns true if the event was consumed, false if not. Note
00204 // that it is acceptable for all event listeners to act on an
00205 // event and not consume it, this return signature exists to
00206 // allow complete propogation of that shred of information from
00207 // the internals of this system to outside uesrs.
00208 //
00209 bool EventManager::trigger (
00210         Event const & inEvent ) const
00211 {
00212         if ( ! validateType( inEvent.getType() ) )
00213                 return false;
00214 
00215         EventListenerMap::const_iterator itWC = m_registry.find( 0 );
00216 
00217         if ( itWC != m_registry.end() )
00218         {
00219                 EventListenerTable const & table = itWC->second;
00220 
00221                 bool processed = false;
00222         
00223                 for ( EventListenerTable::const_iterator it2 = table.begin(),
00224                                   it2End = table.end(); it2 != it2End; it2++ )
00225                 {
00226                         (*it2)->HandleEvent( inEvent );
00227                 }
00228         }
00229         
00230         EventListenerMap::const_iterator it =
00231                 m_registry.find( inEvent.getType().getIdent() );
00232 
00233         if ( it == m_registry.end() )
00234                 return false;
00235 
00236         EventListenerTable const & table = it->second;
00237 
00238         bool processed = false;
00239         
00240         for ( EventListenerTable::const_iterator it2 = table.begin(),
00241                           it2End = table.end(); it2 != it2End; it2++ )
00242         {
00243                 if ( (*it2)->HandleEvent( inEvent ) )
00244                 {
00245                         // only set to true, if processing eats the messages
00246                         processed = true;
00247                 }
00248         }
00249         
00250         return processed;
00251 }
00252 
00253 //
00254 // EventManager::queueEvent                     - Chapter 11, page 363
00255 //
00256 // Fire off event - asynchronous - do it WHEN the event system
00257 // tick() method is called, normally at a judicious time during
00258 // game-loop processing.
00259 //
00260 // returns true if the message was added to the processing queue,
00261 // false otherwise.
00262 //
00263 bool EventManager::queueEvent ( EventPtr const & inEvent )
00264 {
00265         assert ( m_activeQueue >= 0 );
00266         assert ( m_activeQueue < kNumQueues );
00267 
00268         if ( ! validateType( inEvent->getType() ) )
00269                 return false;
00270 
00271         EventListenerMap::const_iterator it =
00272                 m_registry.find( inEvent->getType().getIdent() );
00273 
00274         if ( it == m_registry.end() )
00275         {               
00276                 // if global listener is not active, then abort queue add
00277                 EventListenerMap::const_iterator itWC = m_registry.find( 0 );
00278 
00279                 if ( itWC == m_registry.end() )
00280                 {
00281                         // no listeners for this event, skipit
00282                         return false;
00283                 }
00284         }
00285         
00286         m_queues[m_activeQueue].push_back( inEvent );
00287         
00288         return true;
00289 }
00290 
00291 //
00292 // EventManager::abortEvent                     - Chapter 11, page 364
00293 //
00294 // Find the next-available instance of the named event type and
00295 // remove it from the processing queue.
00296 //
00297 // This may be done up to the point that it is actively being
00298 // processed ...  e.g.: is safe to happen during event processing
00299 // itself.
00300 //
00301 // returns true if the event was found and removed, false
00302 // otherwise
00303 //
00304 bool EventManager::abortEvent ( EventType const & inType,
00305                                                                                         bool allOfType )
00306 {
00307         assert ( m_activeQueue >= 0 );
00308         assert ( m_activeQueue < kNumQueues );
00309 
00310         if ( ! validateType( inType ) )
00311                 return false;
00312 
00313         EventListenerMap::iterator it = m_registry.find( inType.getIdent() );
00314 
00315         if ( it == m_registry.end() )
00316                 return false; // no listeners for this event, skipit
00317 
00318         bool rc = false;
00319         
00320         for ( EventQueue::iterator it = m_queues[m_activeQueue].begin(),
00321                           itEnd = m_queues[m_activeQueue].end(); it != itEnd; it++ )
00322         {
00323                 if ( (*it)->getType() == inType )
00324                 {
00325                         m_queues[m_activeQueue].erase(it);
00326                         rc = true;
00327                         if ( !allOfType )
00328                                 break;
00329                 }
00330         }
00331 
00332         return rc;
00333 }

00336 //
00337 // EventManager::tick                   - Chapter 11, page 365
00338 //
00339 // Allow for processing of any queued messages, optionally
00340 // specify a processing time limit so that the event processing
00341 // does not take too long. Note the danger of using this
00342 // artificial limiter is that all messages may not in fact get
00343 // processed.
00344 //
00345 // returns true if all messages ready for processing were
00346 // completed, false otherwise (e.g. timeout )
00347 //
00348 bool EventManager::tick ( unsigned long maxMillis )
00349 {
00350         unsigned long curMs = GetTickCount();
00351         unsigned long maxMs =
00352                 maxMillis == IEventManager::kINFINITE
00353                 ? IEventManager::kINFINITE
00354                 : (curMs + maxMillis );
00355 
00356         EventListenerMap::const_iterator itWC = m_registry.find( 0 );
00357 
00358         // swap active queues, make sure new queue is empty after the
00359         // swap ...
00360         
00361         int queueToProcess = m_activeQueue;
00362 
00363         m_activeQueue = ( m_activeQueue + 1 ) % kNumQueues;
00364 
00365         m_queues[m_activeQueue].clear();
00366 
00367         // now process as many events as we can ( possibly time
00368         // limited ) ... always do AT LEAST one event, if ANY are
00369         // available ...
00370 
00371         while ( m_queues[queueToProcess].size() > 0 )
00372         {
00373                 EventPtr event = m_queues[queueToProcess].front();
00374 
00375                 m_queues[queueToProcess].pop_front();
00376                 
00377                 EventType const & eventType = event->getType();
00378 
00379                 EventListenerMap::const_iterator itListeners =
00380                         m_registry.find( eventType.getIdent() );
00381 
00382                 if ( itWC != m_registry.end() )
00383                 {
00384                         EventListenerTable const & table = itWC->second;
00385 
00386                         bool processed = false;
00387         
00388                         for ( EventListenerTable::const_iterator
00389                                           it2 = table.begin(), it2End = table.end();
00390                                   it2 != it2End; it2++ )
00391                         {
00392                                 (*it2)->HandleEvent( *event );
00393                         }
00394                 }
00395 
00396                 // no listerners currently for this event type, skipit
00397                 if ( itListeners == m_registry.end() )
00398                         continue;
00399 
00400                 unsigned int const kEventId = itListeners->first;
00401                 EventListenerTable const & table = itListeners->second;
00402 
00403                 for ( EventListenerTable::const_iterator
00404                                   it = table.begin(), end = table.end();
00405                           it != end ; it++ )
00406                 {
00407                         if ( (*it)->HandleEvent( *event ) )
00408                         {
00409                                 break;
00410                         }
00411                 }
00412 
00413                 curMs = GetTickCount();
00414 
00415                 if ( maxMillis != IEventManager::kINFINITE )
00416                 {
00417 
00418                         if ( curMs >= maxMs )
00419                         {
00420                                 // time ran about, abort processing loop
00421                                 break;
00422                         }
00423                 }
00424         }
00425         
00426         // if any events left to process, push them onto the active
00427         // queue.
00428         //
00429         // Note: to preserver sequencing, go bottom-up on the
00430         // raminder, inserting them at the head of the active
00431         // queue...
00432 
00433         bool queueFlushed = ( m_queues[queueToProcess].size() == 0 );
00434 
00435         if ( !queueFlushed )
00436         {
00437                 while ( m_queues[queueToProcess].size() > 0 )
00438                 {
00439                         EventPtr event = m_queues[queueToProcess].back();
00440 
00441                         m_queues[queueToProcess].pop_back();
00442 
00443                         m_queues[m_activeQueue].push_front( event );
00444                 }
00445         }
00446         
00447         // all done, this pass
00448         
00449         return queueFlushed;
00450 }

00454 //
00455 // EventManager::validateType                   - Chapter 11, page 368
00456 //
00457 // Validate an event type, this does NOT add it to the internal
00458 // registry, only verifies that it is legal ( e.g. either the
00459 // ident number is not yet assigned, or it is assigned to
00460 // matching signature text, and the signature text is not empty
00461 // ).
00462 //
00463 bool EventManager::validateType(
00464         EventType const & inType ) const
00465 {
00466         if ( inType.getStr() == NULL )
00467                 return false;
00468 
00469         if ( ( inType.getIdent() == 0 ) &&
00470                  (strcmp(inType.getStr(),kpWildcardEventType) != 0) )
00471                 return false;
00472 
00473         EventTypeSet::const_iterator evIt =
00474                 m_typeList.find( inType );
00475 
00476         if ( evIt != m_typeList.end() )
00477         {
00478                 // verify that the text signature is the same as already
00479                 // known ...
00480 
00481                 EventType const & known = *evIt;
00482 
00483                 char const * const kKnownTag = known.getStr();
00484                 char const * const kNewTag   = inType.getStr();
00485 
00486                 int cv = stricmp( kKnownTag, kNewTag );
00487 
00488                 // tag mismatch for ident value, not accepted
00489                 if ( cv != 0 )
00490                         return false;
00491         }
00492         
00493         return true;
00494 }
00495 
00496 //
00497 // EventManager::getListenerList                - Chapter 11, page 369
00498 //
00499 // Get the list of listeners associated with a specific event
00500 // type
00501 //
00502 EventListenerList EventManager::getListenerList (
00503         EventType const & eventType ) const
00504 {
00505         // invalid event type, so sad
00506         if ( ! validateType( eventType ) )
00507                 return EventListenerList();
00508 
00509         EventListenerMap::const_iterator itListeners =
00510                 m_registry.find( eventType.getIdent() );
00511 
00512         // no listerners currently for this event type, so sad
00513         if ( itListeners == m_registry.end() )
00514                 return EventListenerList();
00515 
00516         EventListenerTable const & table = itListeners->second;
00517 
00518         // there was, but is not now, any listerners currently for
00519         // this event type, so sad
00520         if ( table.size() == 0 )
00521                 return EventListenerList();
00522 
00523         EventListenerList result;
00524 
00525         result.reserve( table.size() );
00526         
00527         for ( EventListenerTable::const_iterator it = table.begin(),
00528                           end = table.end(); it != end ; it++ )
00529         {
00530                 result.push_back( *it );
00531         }
00532 
00533         return result;
00534 }

00537 //
00538 // EventManager::getTypeList                    - Chapter 11, page 369
00539 //
00540 // Get the list of known event types
00541 //
00542 EventTypeList EventManager::getTypeList ( void ) const
00543 {
00544         // no entries, so sad
00545         if ( m_typeList.size() == 0 )
00546                 return EventTypeList();
00547 
00548         EventTypeList result;
00549 
00550         result.reserve( m_typeList.size() );
00551 
00552         for ( EventTypeSet::const_iterator it = m_typeList.begin(),
00553                           itEnd = m_typeList.end(); it != itEnd; it++ )
00554         {
00555                 result.push_back( *it );
00556         }
00557         
00558         return result;
00559 }

00561 //--
00562 // EventSnooper::EventSnooper           - Chapter 11, page 351
00563 //
00564 EventSnooper::EventSnooper( char const * const kpLogFileName )
00565         : m_OutFile(0)
00566 {
00567         if ( kpLogFileName )
00568         {
00569                 // compute the path to our current exe and use it as the
00570                 // basis for the log file ...
00571 
00572                 char fullPathName[MAX_PATH];
00573 
00574                 memset( fullPathName, 0, sizeof(fullPathName) );
00575 
00576                 GetModuleFileNameA( NULL, fullPathName, MAX_PATH );
00577 
00578                 // normalize path separators, take note of the last
00579                 // separator found as we go ... if any
00580 
00581                 char * pSep = NULL;
00582 
00583                 for ( size_t i = 0, j = strlen(fullPathName); i < j ; i++ )
00584                 {
00585                         if ( fullPathName[i] == '\\' )
00586                         {
00587                                 fullPathName[i] = '/';
00588 
00589                                 pSep = & fullPathName[i];
00590                         }
00591                 }
00592 
00593                 if ( pSep != NULL )
00594                 {
00595                         strcpy( pSep + 1, kpLogFileName );
00596                 }
00597                 else
00598                 {
00599                         strcpy( fullPathName, kpLogFileName );
00600                 }
00601                 
00602                 m_OutFile = fopen(fullPathName, "w+");
00603         }
00604 }

00607 // EventSnooper::EventSnooper           - Chapter 11, page 352
00608 //
00609 EventSnooper::~EventSnooper()
00610 {
00611         if ( !m_OutFile)
00612                 fclose( m_OutFile );
00613 }

00616 //
00617 // EventSnooper::EventSnooper           - Chapter 11, page 352
00618 //
00619 bool EventSnooper::HandleEvent( Event const & event )
00620 {
00621 #ifdef _DEBUG
00622         memset( m_msgBuf, 0, sizeof(m_msgBuf));
00623         
00624 #pragma warning( push )
00625 #pragma warning( disable : 4313 ) 
00626 
00627         _snprintf( m_msgBuf, sizeof(m_msgBuf)-1,
00628                 "Event Snoop : event %08lx time %g : type %08lx [%s] : \n",
00629                 & event,
00630                 event.getTime(),
00631                 event.getType().getIdent(),
00632                 event.getType().getStr(),
00633                 0 );
00634 
00635 #pragma warning( pop )
00636 
00637         OutputDebugStringA( m_msgBuf );
00638 
00639         if ( m_OutFile != NULL )
00640         {
00641                 fwrite( m_msgBuf, (DWORD) strlen(m_msgBuf), 1, m_OutFile );
00642         }
00643 #endif
00644 
00645         return false;
00646 }
